title: Magnetotransport in a Dual-Gated Bilayer CrSBr Device
description: Extensive magnetotransport investigation of a dual-gated bilayer CrSBr device (D1). The study explores the electrical properties (Rxx, Rxy) as a function of temperature (23K, 60K), dual-gate voltages (carrier density and electric field), and magnetic field (strength and orientation). Key observations include strong magnetoresistance (MR) with hysteresis, gate-tunable insulating states, and significant magnetic anisotropy revealed by in-plane field rotation. The data shows a gate-tunable sign change in the MR, possibly indicating a weak localization to weak anti-localization transition, and characteristic 'bunny ear' features in the Hall resistance.
